intro: Nasturtium camelinae, commonly known as the common nasturtium, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant produces bright orange or yellow flowers with four petals, and its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its seeds are edible and have a peppery taste, similar to that of watercress. Nasturtium camelinae is often grown as a decorative plant and is also used in herbal remedies for its purported health benefits.
